I added more! 😅

For whatever it’s worth, my feedback as a solo female traveler returning just a week ago!

Rome-Reggio Emilia-Florence-Rome

-TheFork was clutch! I perused restaurants and made reservations easily. Download it.

-I never once had an issue with needing a toilet, so The Flush app was pointless for me.

-GoogleTranslate - a perk, even after my year of learning Italian.

-FreeNow - Lifesaver!!!! For taxis in Rome area.

-GO to Emma Pizzeria and do not ask questions. And then go again. 😰 AMAZING. PS - I did lunch both times; might be ideal to make a reservation. Eat from the seasonal menu. Also Mazzè - make a rez.

-Trenitalia App - Used to book all of my train tickets. FYI - I found the best luck on choices the morning of the day prior. I tried one day-of morning and was looking looking at later afternoon. A previous post had me navigating the train stations easily!

-Visit the Farmacias for the BEST cosmetic goods! Happy to add more if interested. Here are two vids that did not steer me wrong! LOVE what I got! PS - also snagged some mini nail polish that lasted forevvvver.

https://www.tiktok.com/t/ZT88TXBX9/
https://www.tiktok.com/t/ZT88Ttrvj/

-In Florence, visit Ugo Poggi Firenze for antiques. The oldest in the area. I got a silver ring and custom set of glasses. If you have something in mind (or don’t! in my case), they are so patient.

-In Florence, there was a TON of shopping around - high-end, mainstream, etc. Dare I say almost a bit too commercialized in some areas?

-Florence: pack your patience (and water!) and head to Piazzale Michelangelo. You will overlook the entire city. It was breathtaking (literally…aside from being 97 and sunny when I did it). You won’t regret it. Worst case, you can barrel roll down the hills/steps to return to civilization. (JK)

-PLEASE go to Officina Profumo-Farmaceutica di Santa Maria Novella in Florence. It meets luxury cosmetics/candles, etc. and mini museum. And by luxury, I mean quality but you will not spend too much at all. I snagged a rose water and lip moisturizer because .. why not, and I spent $50 euro?

-If you decide to impulsively get a tattoo in Florence, check out Florence Tattoo Studio and message them a day in advance. They were fun and my work is great!

-Wherever you go, when lunch hits, grab a sandwich at a local shop and then grab a stool on the road and enjoy. One of my favorite parts of the trip.

-If traveling soon, YES, it is HOT. I am used to hot, but not HUMID in Colorado where I live. My neck fan was amazing. While it could be my perimenopause 😅 it was spi￼iiicy, even in the FCO airport. My thicker thighs never suffered with some lightweight spanx. I sweat non-stop. My afternoons, I took a break and would relax or take a cold shower.

-I saw another post recently about “begging” for water..I never once had this happen. I always had euros on me and there are stands alllll over the place. Bottles were typically 1 euro, 1.50 at most. Plus..the fountains?

-Caution: This only happened in Reggio Emilia. Following a LARGE scale concert, the city was not equipped and gridlocked for hours. I understand. However when I finally got a cab (about 4:30a) to my lodging about 15mins outside of town, I had a touchy-feely driver who grabbed at my thighs and went in for more as I paid for my ride. I was able to fend off, but unsettling nonetheless. Given that, if traveling solo - an AirTag is great, as is a personal alarm device like Birdie. All that said, I did NOT feel uncomfortable even once in more populated areas.

Lodging - FYI: every hotel had AC and hair dryer if that’s your thing!

Rome: Unahotels Trestevere Roma - Great!! Rooftop bar is lovely, although the staff can be a bit lagging.

Reggio Emilia: Hotel La Vecchia Reggio - this place was so quaint. It was more remote than I’d choose, but hotels were entirely sold out because of the concert. I loved it here.

Florence: Hotel Perseo - I LOVED this spot. It’s quite compact but for 1-2, it is lovely (perhaps larger for more accommodation!) I felt like I was staying with a friend. Breakfast was especially special - you could just tell the extra care.

Rome (again): Hotel Ripa - Eh. Just avoid. They really want to be legit, but they are not. You enter to some fancy art installations and then enter your room and it looks like someone had a frat party and forgot to clean. Little basics were dirty - mirror, sink, around toilet, eh. The bar/restaurant was fine during happy hour, but when arriving back with a colleague at 10:45, they said no to a glass of wine (not table service) at closing time 11p.

Random Thoughts:

-I packed a carry-on backpack (BEST choice) with just three outfits, plus a tote and cross-body purse. I also packed laundry detergent sheets to wash along the way and rewore (is that a word?) outfits/mixed and matched. It was great!

-Ultimately I snagged a carry-on suitcase from a stand/vendor on the street. Worth the $35 to pack my stuff that was above 3.5oz to the US.

-I bought Skechers sneakers and put some inserts in those babies and I was golden! Sure, my feet were tired from 7+ miles a day but never sore, blistered, etc. And I bought no-show socks with the little padding around the heel. Perfect.

-Portable chargers! I brought two and they came in handy. I brought along my own converter but had a hell of a time. It would charge a few percentage and get too hot. I ended up at an Apple Store and just bought a local charger. Worth it!

All that said, if you can take the solo trip, do it!!
